title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 31 January 2016 - XWiki

14:06 <iphar`> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <ansuz> hmm  
14:30 <ansuz> I wonder why it's telling me to check my logs  
14:30 <ansuz> I don't have logs  
14:30 <vmassol> ansuz: nah dpn't worry  
14:30 <vmassol> it's a bug of the irc bot  
14:30 <vmassol> I need to fix it one day, been happening from time to time for a long time now  
14:31 <ansuz> todo++;  
14:31 <vmassol> yeah  
14:31 <vmassol> working on finishing my antispam tools over the weekend :)  
14:33 <ansuz> yay  
14:33 <ansuz> I'm working on cryptpad  
14:33 <ansuz> lol  
14:33 <ansuz> the fun parts, though  
14:34 <vmassol> :)  
14:34 <ansuz> http://transitiontech.ca:3000/render/#presentation  
14:36 <vmassol> nice  
14:38 <ansuz> so now I can tune in the projector on my tablet to the same pad, and make edits in markdown for a realtime presentation  
14:38 <ansuz> >like a boss  
14:38 <vmassol> :)  
14:39 <vmassol> you should use the xwiki rendering  
14:39 <vmassol> to support all syntaxes, including markdown  
14:39 <ansuz> lemme know when it's implemented in javascript, I guess?  
14:39 <vmassol> hmm ok fair point ;)  
14:40 <ansuz> or I guess we could make an api endpoint that accepts arbitrary text and renders it without saving a document  
14:40 <ansuz> but then you'd be hammering the server pretty hard, this parses markdown whenever you stop typing for 500ms  
14:42 <vmassol> I've implemented a POC of that btw:  
14:43 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/angular-rendering  
14:43 <ansuz> neat  
14:43 <ansuz> we could probably use the vdom stuff I've been doing to improve performance a bit  
14:44 <ansuz> it takes a diff and only redraws what it has to  
14:44 <vmassol> hmm diff is hard for syntax  
14:44 <vmassol> syntax rendering I mean  
14:44 <ansuz> it diffs a dom  
14:44 <vmassol> ok so you still render the whole thing  
14:45 <vmassol> but only redraw what's needed?  
14:45 <ansuz> sort of, it exists in the browser, yea  
14:45 <vmassol> hmm thought it was the browser's job to do taht  
14:45 <vmassol> \*that  
14:45 <ansuz> but the redraws are the expensive part  
14:45 <ansuz> it should be, but browsers don't really do it  
14:45 <ansuz> if you do like a $('#target').html(newThing); it just destroys the whole content and redraws  
14:46 <vmassol> ok  
14:46 <ansuz> the vdom lib I'm using finds the elements that change, and actually only changes their properties if that's the only difference  
14:47 <ansuz> there are some bugs, but I found you can have a youtube video playing in an iframe, and patch the bigger section without the youtube video stopping  
14:47 <ansuz> I think it's just an off by one error in the code, one extra element is always redrawn unnecessesarily  
14:47 <ansuz> the next element after the one you changed  
14:49 <ansuz> so it's mostly useful if you want to have live elements like videos or if you've bound to events on that item  
14:49 <ansuz> may or may not be useful depending on the context  
14:50 <ansuz> hmm, maybe angular already does something like that?  
14:50 <ansuz> I've never used it  
14:54 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

18:29 <OSIMasson> vmassol: any idea why I would get a download prompt to download a file, "W5Za+dCF.bin" when I try to got to www.xwiki.com using Mozilla?  
18:32 <vmassol> hi OSIMasson  
18:32 <vmassol> hmm looks weird and wrong  
18:32 <vmassol> you mean when going to the home page?  
18:32 <OSIMasson> vmassol: Odd, when I try to visit xwiki.con I get a prompt to download that file.  
18:32 <OSIMasson> vmassol: yes  
18:33 <vmassol> ok I'll raise it to the xwiki.com people  
18:34 <OSIMasson> OK, I just sent a screen shot and the file to "contact@..."  
18:34 <vmassol> thanks
